item.title: Remembering the Hotel San Remo: A Taste of Italy on the Las Vegas Strip
item.description:
A Different Kind of Strip Experience

The late 1980s and early 1990s in Las Vegas were a time of explosive growth. Megaresorts like the Mirage and Luxor were changing the face of the Strip, promising spectacle and excess. But nestled just east of this rising tide of behemoths, a different kind of oasis opened its doors: the Hotel San Remo. On July 1, 1989, Japanese businessman Sukeaki Izumi unveiled his vision â€“ a mid-sized resort that prioritized intimacy, affordability, and a distinctly European flair. Replacing a Polynesian-themed resort on Tropicana Avenue, the San Remo offered something unique.
